characters: DO YOU HAVE EYES IN YOUR HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP ON A LARGE BREAST as it is maneuvered into a mammogram machine. A PAIR OF HANDS lift it, pull it and eventually squeeze into nothing more than a small tube of flesh as it’s pressed down by a sandwich of glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various shots of more breasts, young and old, high and lo as they get their mammograms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATIENTS flip through magazines, RECEPTIONISTS answer pho and make appointments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WOMEN in paper robes, mostly over 50, sit in chairs that the hallway, waiting their turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN ANXIOUS WOMAN removes her robe to expose her small breasts. The technician is REBECCA, 28 years old and plai looking.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Let’s do the left first. Rebecca does her best to get the woman’s left breast onto plate of glass. The woman winces.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I think I can get...a little more. Rebecca closes the machine on her tit and moves to flip a switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARISSA AND CATHY, receptionists, do some filing.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: I think they’re at their peak this week-end. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA
dialogues.text: I can’t go til the end of the month.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: That's too bad. They might be over by then.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA
dialogues.text: I know. And New York magazine gave a list where they’re the best this year. Rebecca enters the front office.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA
dialogues.text: Rebecca, you gonna see the leaves? Rebecca stares at her blankly.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA
dialogues.text: The leaves. Upstate? They change color?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE, 45 years old and attractive, is being lead through enormous, dark apartment by a middle aged man, ADAM. The place is filled with furniture from the 50's, along with life time of mementos and tchotchkes.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I apologize for the smell. We cracked the windows but it didn’t help.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh, it’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: My mother was always cold. Most of the windows were actually painted shut. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08 ADAM (cont'd) (pointing to the living room set) This stuff all matches. It’s the original upholstery, I’m sure. Pretty dreary.  Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08 Kate looks around, blase about what she’s seeing.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You don’t buy the little stuff, right? Like jewelry and clothes?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: We just buy furniture. Sometimes artwork, pottery.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: It’s better to just get rid of it all at once like this, right? I mean, it’s a bunch of junk and I’m a busy person.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh, definitely. You don’t want to have to worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (chuckling) I'll probably get rid of some priceless thing and not know it, right? Like this. He holds up a vase that’s decorated with gold leaves.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh, I don’t think you have to concern yourself with that. (beat) This is a beautiful place, though. You going to keep it?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Na. I like the suburbs.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: This kind of space in Manhattan is unreal.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah, if you like Manhattan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca, (the mammographer) gets into the elevator with groceries. After a moment, Kate gets in as well, and they smile coldly to one another. The doors close and they rid up. 3. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (after a while) Weirdly hot today, huh?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I work inside.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (snapping) You had to go outside to get to work. And to leave work, right? Rebecca shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: How’s your grandmother?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (pointed) Great. Doing really well. They both get out on the same floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca walks to the left to Apartment 6A. Kate walks to right, to Apartment 6B. INT. APT. 6A/ANDRA’S APARTMENT - DAY 9 Rebecca unloads groceries in ANDRA’S prewar one bedroom apartment. The kitchen is original, tiles are missing, pl are washed badly. The room smells of urine and medicine. ANDRA, 90 years old, is sitting at the small kitchen tabl Her face rests in its permanent frown as she holds her li bull dog LUCKY -- their expressions sadly resembling one another's.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: I don’t know why you don’t go to Associated.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: You do know.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: If it was your money you’d walk the extra six blocks.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: It’s ten blocks. And no I wouldn’t.  10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: When my feet get better I’1l do it myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A two bedroom apartment, bright and cluttered but stylish decorated. Kate is cooking dinner while her DAUGHTER ABBY, 15, does homework at the table. Abby is in an awkward stage of development and has a bad case of acne.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Why does she hate us so much? What did we do to her?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: She sees you, she sees death. You're a vulture.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Us buying that apartment has no down side. Her grandmother’s still living there, we’re not hovering. The only difference to her is that now she pays her rent to us instead of the sponsor. And we didn’t even raise it.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: You're a saint.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (beat) Maybe she’s mean because she has a prettier sister.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Mom.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I’ve seen the older one. She’s kind of gorgeous in a low rent way.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: The younger one is okay looking. Maybe she likes how she looks.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I doubt it. It’s hard to have a prettier sister. 5.  Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: It’s just so sad.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: The old lady. Andra. I mean, does she ever go outside?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: What’s so fun outside?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: The world? Life?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Maybe she’s perfectly happy.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: That’s how you rationalize so you don’t have to feel bad for her.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Why do I have to feel bad for her?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: She’s a lonely old woman at the end of her life.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: That’s not my fault. ALEX, Kate’s husband, comes into the room sifting through 5/19/08 photos. He’s 42 and attractive despite a pot belly and unkempt hair.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: This table is incredibly rare.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: He had no idea.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What about this chest of drawers? Is it signed? 6.  Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: And in perfect condition.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What a score. You did good! We’re going to make a killing. He affectionately ruffles her hair.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Don’t say that.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: But we are.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Mom knows you are. She just doesn’t want it said. (beat) My zit medicine isn’t working.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (looking closer) You won’t use what I tell you.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: It made it worse.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You don’t take my advice.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: So I deserve it?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I’m trying to help you.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Don't help me. 11 INT. ANDRA’S APARTMENT - A LITTLE LATER 11 Andra sits in a chair a few inches away from an OLD TV SE it’s BLASTING NEWS. Rebecca sits at the dining table near window putting pills into a Daily Pill Organizer.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (shouting over the TV) What shall we do for your birthday? Mary and I will take you out.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: Mary?  12

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Sure. She’s just been really busy. Andra smirks. Rebecca glances out the window, a warm, fal breeze blowing on her face. She sees a small roof top party going on a few buildings away. The BBQ sends sweet smells into the sky, YOUNG PEOP laugh and enjoy themselves. Her face saddens as she returns to separating pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca kicks off her shoes as she collapses onto the cou The apartment is small and dreary, short of a couple of generic posters and inexpensive attempts at cheerful decorating.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Why is it so hot? Rebecca’s sister Mary, 33, very pretty with a tense, turn down mouth, leans into the room holding up a frozen dinne Beef Medallions.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Please tell me what a medallion is.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: When you win something.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: These look like - shit pellets. (beat) You want one?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Sure. Thanks. Mary retreats into the kitchen and Rebecca picks up an IN TOUCH magazine.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You would not believe what she was wearing today. Rebecca rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: This backless dress and man, she has a big back. Not attractive. (MORE)

Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08 MARY (0.S.) (cont'd) Not the kind of back that can carry off that kind of dress, you know what I mean? Why don’t people look in the mirror? (beat) Like a dude. You know?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: It’s weird, the way you watch her.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I don’t watch her. I walk by.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (beat) We gotta do something for Grandma’s birthday.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: When is she gonna croak?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: What if somebody said something like that about you?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: They probably already have.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I’m gonna buy her a nightgown.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I don’t know. She’s got a ratty old thing.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I‘1l write you a check.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: You know the neighbors? They look at me like, is she dead yet?  13 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Why shouldn't they?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Because it’s wrong.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: You think that if they didn’t buy her apartment she wouldn’t die? What’s the difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loft like store modern furniture.

dialogues.speaker: DAY 13
dialogues.text: on tenth avenue filled with mid century try out a long, thin sofa.

dialogues.speaker: MALE SHOPPER 1
dialogues.text: Feel this texture. Nubby but soft.

dialogues.speaker: MALE SHOPPER 2
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it’s not comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: MALE SHOPPER 1
dialogues.text: It’s nice.

dialogues.speaker: MALE SHOPPER 2
dialogues.text: It’s not, it’s too shallow or something.

dialogues.speaker: MALE SHOPPER 1
dialogues.text: Well, you don’t have to converse with it.

dialogues.speaker: MALE SHOPPER 2
dialogues.text: Very funny. Alex comes up.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Beautiful, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: MALE SHOPPER 1
dialogues.text: Gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: And comfortable. It’s actually ten feet long.

dialogues.speaker: MALE SHOPPER 2
dialogues.text: How much. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08 Alex goes across the large room to the desk area where Ka is working and looks in a binder for the price. Kate glan at the couch the guys are sitting on.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with that piece?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (quietly) It’s not comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: We should take it off the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (to shouting to Man 2) It’s very comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Why did you do that?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: He might think it’s comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: That’s not possible.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You don’t know that. She watches Alex return to the shoppers and tell them the price. By their body language, she can tell they don’t wa the couch. She’s vindicated. Abby enters from the street and flops down on a womb like chair. She’s got an enormous backpack.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: I saw these jeans I want.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Cute.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Two.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You want two hundred dollar jeans.  14 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: That’s what you spend.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I’m a grown up.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: That makes no sense. It’s what jeans cost.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I am not spending two hundred dollars on a pair of jeans for my teenage daughter when there’s forty five homeless people on our street.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: What does that have to do with anything? They don’t want jeans. Alex comes up to Abby and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Hi, honey. You look pretty.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca is filing while DOCTOR LERNER (40), and the receptionists chat.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LERNER
dialogues.text: My wife and I drove up to Woodstock.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: Were they gorgeous?

dialogues.speaker: DR. LERNER
dialogues.text: Oh, incredible. The kids didn’t care but we loved it. (beat) Rebecca, you going to see the leaves?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: DR. LERNER
dialogues.text: You should. They’re spectacular. And they’re just about to end.  15 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LERNER
dialogues.text: Really. Not to be missed. Blushing, Rebecca takes a file and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LERNER
dialogues.text: Next time I’1l invite you to come with us.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (shy) Great, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca sits opposite a GUY, 30 years old. He’s very clea cut and dressed formally. He refers to a printed out piec paper as he occasionally looks up at Rebecca.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: So it says here you grew up in New York.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Yes, in the village.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Do you think that’s good, to grow up in the city?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I do. I mean, I saw a lot of things I probably shouldn’t have seen, but it got me to grow up fast. I was really independent. Which in some ways is good.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: I think it’s an awful place to raise kids. It’s filthy, crime ridden, noisy. And it’s only getting worse.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Well, that’s true too. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: (back to paper) Funny, you said - you know, in your questionnaire, that you had dark brown hair. (beat) It’s really kind of light brown.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Really. I think it’s dark.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t call it dark. It’s more ash.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: But it’s brown. I mean, I didn’t lie.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: (insisting) But it’s not dark brown.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: It is. AND ALEX’S BEDROOM - NIGHT 16 Alex is in bed watching ACCESS HOLLYWOOD, listening to a story about Nicole Ritchie. Kate climbs in with a book. She turns

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Are you attracted to her? (beat) Humor me.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: She exists purely for people like me to fantasize about. Except I think she’s going to hit the wall early. to him.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Hit the wall.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: She’s not gonna look good when she gets older. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You mean, when she’s like twenty seven.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: More like thirty. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (opening her book) That’s nice.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Artie threw something at his new assistant.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Ohmygod. I think my ovary fell out!

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Howard was really mad but Artie is in anger management so he’s giving him another chance. (beat) It was very entertaining.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (turning to him) You know you used to read books. (beat) Well, magazines.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Don’t wreck my fun.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I won't.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Don’t wreck my fun. (beat) I don’t have any fun.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: None?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Will you rub my feet? He pulls her feet onto his lap and rubs them. She closes eyes.  17 18 19 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08 He looks at her toes.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: When did your feet get all mangled together? One toe is actually going horizontal. (to the toe) You're going the wrong way, little buddy. Go up!

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Ow. INT. KATE AND ALEX’S BEDROOM - NIGHT 17 Alex is sleeping, but Kate can’t. She climbs out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In her pajamas, Kate is surfing the internet. She types i Volunteer Opportunities and a long list comes up. She rea the different situations, each sadder than the next (ie: mentor to at-risk teens, read to the blind, feed quadriplegics at the VA, etc).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca is giving an old woman, MRS. PORTMAN, a mammogram

dialogues.speaker: MRS. PORTMAN
dialogues.text: I let my hair go grey when I was forty. Why fake it.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: People say it makes you look older.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. PORTMAN
dialogues.text: That's probably true. I didn’t like the idea of chemicals on my head. And I didn’t like that color everyone ended up with. Menopausal brown, I used to call it.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I think I know what you’re talking about. That’s what my Grandma has.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. PORTMAN
dialogues.text: How old is she? Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: She's going to be ninety one this week. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Portman, now dressed in her regular clothes, comes i the waiting room with Rebecca.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. PORTMAN
dialogues.text: Eugene. Mrs. Portman’s grandson EUGENE, smiles when he sees her. is 35 and impossibly handsome.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. PORTMAN
dialogues.text: Eugene, honey. This is Rebecca. Eugene reaches out and shakes Rebecca’s hand. She’s shy, dumbstruck by his good looks.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. PORTMAN
dialogues.text: Rebecca, this is my grandson. An angel. Eugene stands up, revealing himself to be fairly short.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: Do you see it?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: My halo.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (smiling) Nice meeting you.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: You, too. Rebecca turns around and goes back into the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary is putting two frozen dinners into the microwave. Rebecca is getting out silverware. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: You should cook them separately.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Same difference.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I think it takes longer.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: This is a fascinating conversation.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (looking at Mary’s skin) You laid out today.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Booth.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: It’s so bad for you. You of all people should know.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I’m very careful. It’s better than the natural rays. (beat) You could use some color.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I don’t want cancer.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Blush doesn’t cause cancer.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Actually -

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: What.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: There’s talc. And parabens.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Oh, come on. 22 EXT. APT. 6A/ANDRA’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 22 Alex is knocking on Andra’s door. Kate is beside him, put a leash on their dog. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Andra! It’s Alex and Kate!

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It’s Alex! From next door! We’re going to the drug store, I wanted to know - The door swings open. Andra, in her ripped and faded robe hair askew, looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: We're going to the store. Do you need anything? Andra walks away. In a moment she returns with a list.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (looking it over) Okay. You got it.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: I hope you’re not going to Windsor. They’re crooks.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Duane Reade.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DUANE READE.
dialogues.text: Andra stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: You gained weight.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Pardon me?

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: (shouting as if he was deaf) Excuse me for saying. You’re a very large man. Kate chuckles.  23 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Thanks!

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Kate walk. He looks at Andra’s list.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Look at what she needs just to take a crap. (beat, pleased) Good.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (glancing at it) Why do all old ladies write the same? (beat) I’m going to write that way.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: She has all this hair on her chin. Thick black ones. In her nose, too.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: She probably can’t see them. (beat) Why are you looking at me like that?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Like what.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (resolved) Yes, I’m probably going to have black hairs on my chin. I already do, you know. What are you so afraid of?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Everything gets hairy and turned the wrong way.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You're gonna get hairy and turned the wrong way. You already are. 20. 23 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: At least you’re not large.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I think she’s turning ninety one.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Unbelievable. Who would have thought.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: We should have bought that apartment downstairs. I think that guy died last week.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: The guy right below us. Martin something.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: That asshole? (beat) No, the whole two story thing would have been too much money. They pass a TRANSVESTITE HOMELESS PERSON sitting against building. She’s applying lipstick (badly). Kate stops, pu a buck out of her pocket and hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSVESTITE
dialogues.text: Thank you, Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You’re welcome.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (confused) Who's Jamie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex is putting the items for Andra in a basket. Kate is looking at things on the shelves when she sees something stops her. It’s Abby, listening to her ipod, unaware that they’re th She’s staring intently at the Maybelline make-up on the w  25 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Alex. She waves him over and he sees Abby. They both watch her choose some foundation, then put it back. She takes an ey pencil and examines its color. That too, she puts back. Kate and Alex stare as if watching something very separat from themselves, and at the same time, excruciatingly clo They're almost in a trance.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: She’s real.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate directs TWO GUYS to move furniture around the store. recognize some of the pieces from the apartment in the beginning. Kate is holding the vase with the gold leaves it.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Let’s put that chair by the window. God, that’s gorgeous! I don’t even want to sell it! (beat) Great. Let’s get the dining room table and put it over there. We’1l have to move those chairs around. Alex comes out of the back and approaches Kate, noticing vase.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Not sure. He looks at the furniture being moved around.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: They're pretty nice.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I think she kept plastic on them for fifty years. They should be in a museum!  26 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What should we ask for the sofa? Five thousand?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: More. Maybe seven. (beat, excited) I feel guilty!

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What’s this? There's a gift basket by the desk, filled with bath and beauty products.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I got it for Andra. I thought maybe we could have her over for dinner. I think it’s her birthday in a couple of days.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You're joking.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No. And invite her miserable granddaughter. s.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Sounds fun.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I don’t like having bad vibes right next door. You know?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Hey. I heard the guy below us had some nice stuff. Kate turns to him, excited. INT. DEAD GUY'S APARTMENT —- CONTINUOUS 26 A gloomy place filled with newspapers and medicine bottle and AMAZING VINTAGE FURNITURE. The dead guy’s daughter, E 50, shows Alex and Kate around. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I hope you don’t mind the super gave us your number.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: I don’t know if you’re gonna want any of our things, though.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I’m sorry about your father.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: He was really sick. He was old.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (looking around) I think there are some pieces we could use.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Yeah? Huh. It’s so old fashioned, I didn’t think anybody wanted this stuff anymore. This was my dad. I guess you knew him. She points to an old BLACK AND WHITE PHOTO of a handsome young man standing in front of his car.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: He was such a nice man. (beat) So, what's going to happen to the apartment?

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: Oh. The neighbors - (she points to the wall) They bought it. They’re gonna make a bigger place, I guess. They’re probably celebrating over there.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh, no. (beat) What did they pay?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Kate.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. That was really rude! Awkward smiles. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Kate, along with Abby, are finishing their dinne

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Do you know he used to throw away our mail if it was put in his box by mistake.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (appalled) And he knew who we were?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Totally. (beat) That’s where all my magazines went. See? It’s his fault I watch TV!

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Well, now he’s dead so you can start reading again.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Thank god!

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: He was mean to Pickles. She always licked his feet. He wore those sandals.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: They must have been sweaty.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Barf.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I wish your Grandpa was alive to hang out with you like that. He gestures to a MAN with a LITTLE BOY at a nearby table.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I think that’s his dad.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (quietly) No, he’s old.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You're old.  28 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I look like that? Kate shrugs. He looks at Abby.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I look like that?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Like what? Kate stops a WAITER.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Excuse me, could I take this home? She gestures to her uneaten food and he takes the plate a

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (beat, to Abby) That’s me you're kicking, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, Alex and Abby exit the restaurant, Kate holding her doggie bag. As they walk down the street, they pass an OL BLACK MAN standing in front of a different restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Sir? He turns to look at her.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Are you hungry? Would you like this? Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08 She offers him her doggie bag. The man glares at her, appalled.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: I'm waiting for a table. Alex, Abby and Kate are mortified.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh, my god, of course you are! I’m so sorry! Please forgive me! Alex clenches his jaw as he leads her away. Abby pretends doesn’t know them.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Are you out of your mind?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: He looked homeless!

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: He looked like a black man waiting for a table!

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 29
dialogues.text: Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby is waiting at the elevator when Rebecca comes out of Andra’s place with a laundry basket.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: You do your Grandma’s laundry.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Is it gross?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Old lady underwear.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I don’t really look.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Good idea. They wait.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: I heard you guys are coming over later.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: (not cool) Cool.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Yeah. The elevator arrives and they get in.  31 32 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08 INT. ELEVATOR —- CONTINUOUS 31 They ride in silence. On another floor, a friendly MAN ge in.

dialogues.speaker: FRIENDLY MAN
dialogues.text: Hi, gals. Gorgeous day. Going to see the leaves! The girls smile. When they get to the lobby he races out. They slowly follow.

dialogues.speaker: FRIENDLY MAN
dialogues.text: Have a great day! Rebecca turns to Abby.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: The leaves! What is with these people?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I know!

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Who gives a shit?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I don't.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Really. They head out of the building.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: See you.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: See you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby shops for jeans. She checks the price tags, all the jeans are over two hundred dollars. She holds a pair up t her body and they’re obviously too small. In fact, everyt and everyone in this store is too small. She catches her reflection in the mirror, noticing a zit starting to appear on the tip of her nose. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: SALESGIRL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (snooty) Can I help you? Startled, Abby turns and heads out of the store.  33 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t charge so much for jeans.

dialogues.speaker: SALESGIRL
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Then maybe you shouldn’t shop in here. INT. APT. 6A/ANDRA’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 33 Andra is tying her old shoes with some difficulty.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (taking over) I’ll do it.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: (annoyed) When I get my eyes fixed I'll be able to do it myself. We hear banging cabinets in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Grandma! You don’t have anything to drink in this place!

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: Who's talking?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Mary. She’s looking for alcohol.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (muttering) This place is filthy.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (shouting) I clean it. Mary comes out of the kitchen with a bulging, unopened ca grapefruit juice.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: This has botulism. Rebecca and Andra look at her blankly. Mary replaces it i the kitchen and then returns.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Why exactly are we going there?  Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: So they can poison Grandma and demolish her apartment.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Then let’s make it fast. Rebecca hands Andra a wrapped box.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: What’s this?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: It’s a tuna, Grandma. What do you think? Happy Birthday. She opens the box and lifts up a pink satin nightgown wit lace and pearls.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: Too fancy.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: What am I going to do with this?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: You sleep in it.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Say “Thank You,” Grandma. Andra puts it back in the box.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: No, actually. You didn’t. 30. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I just thought since yours is so old.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: I'll save it for a special occasion.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (amused) And what special occasion might that be, Andra?

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: It’s too nice to sleep in. That’s all. You probably spent too much.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: You deserve to sleep in something nice.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: (closing the box) It’s too nice. 34 INT. KATE AND ALEX’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 34 Rebecca, Mary and Andra are entering the place.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: We're pretty cramped here, but welcome! (beat) Happy Birthday, Andra! Andra looks around.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: (whispering loudly to Mary) What’s that smell?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Grandma. Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: (loud whisper) I smell something burnt. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: You know everyone CAN HEAR YOU. (to Kate) Sorry. She’s rude. You should smell her place!

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: My place doesn’t smell.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Oh, right, piss and mold have no odor, what was I thinking?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Mary.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No worries. Everyone, come sit down. Anybody like some wine?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Oh. Would you have any bourbon? Rebecca glares at her.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (coming from kitchen) I think we do have bourbon. Hi. (to Mary) I’m Alex.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Mary. Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (finding the bourbon) Where'd you get that tan?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (pleased) Oh, you know.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: She lies on a tanning bed.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I go to the Sheep Meadow.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: She lies on a tanning bed.  35 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: AND I go to the Sheep Meadow.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Either way, looks good!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (glaring at Rebecca) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate is knocking on Abby’s bedroom door. No response. She enters to find Abby on her bed listening to her i-pod.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Take those off. Annoyed, she does.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Why are you in here? Abby points to the big red zit on her nose.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I don’t understand.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: I’m not going out there with this thing on my nose.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Don’t be ridiculous. You can’t even see it.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: SEE IT? It’s swallowing my whole face! How can you not see it?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I told you to stop eating french fries and greasy crap.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: It makes no difference. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Please come out and join us. You look fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone (except Abby) is sitting at the table eating. Ma is a little buzzed, so is Alex.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I mean, if she was younger than me, actually, I think she is younger than me, but if she were prettier than me I’d understand. But she’s not, and she’s got this tan - totally sprayed on - I would know. The worst part is her back, though.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (trying) Are you still in love with him?

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: He broke up with her.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: That’s not how it went down.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with her back?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: It’s muscular. All built up. And she wears these skimpy tops.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: That’s not good.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: No, right? Big Back is not good.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Enough about her back.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I don’t understand. When do you see her?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: She works in a store near where Mary works. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh. What do you do?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I work in a spa. Downtown. You know Face Works? I do facials there.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh, cool. And what about you, Rebecca? What do you do?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I administer mammograms. I'ma radiology technician.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I had no idea. Is that interesting?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: If you like boobs it is!

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: You pop blackheads for a living. (beat, to Kate) It is interesting. I like the people. You know, the patients.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Crush on the boss. Rebecca shoots a look at Mary. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08 Abby enters with a pair of underwear over her head.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Abby what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: She's covering a zit you can’t even see. Abby, take them off, that’s disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: (re: Abby) Who is that? Is that funny?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (to Abby) You should come to the spa. Facials really help. Lets see it. Abby shakes her head no.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Come on, I’ve seen it all. Slowly Abby removes the underwear.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Whoa. That’s a big one!

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: She’s drunk.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: And on your nose. It’s almost cystic. Horrible.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Mary!

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: No, I’d rather someone admit it. At least then I don’t feel crazy. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I know exactly what you’re saying. Half the time I do feel crazy.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Nobody ever says the truth.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: They should. If you get a sucky haircut, people should admit it. If some doctor procedure is going to hurt, they should say it’s going to hurt. It makes you feel worse if they lie.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: I hate it when people don’t say bless you.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: You know what I hate? When you’re in like, a store, and you hold the door for the person behind you but then they don’t hold the door for the person behind them? And you're standing there like a fucking doorman!

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: And they don’t say thank you!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Of course not! ‘Cause you’re not there! And at that she opens her purse, pulls out a lip gloss an aggressively applies it.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Jesus, sometimes I swear I must be invisible. She hands the lip gloss to Abby, who takes it, flattered.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (less in awe) Anyone for coffee?  37 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andra, Rebecca and Mary are sitting on the couch drinking coffee and eating cookies. Mary is drinking another bourb Alex, Kate and Abby are sitting across from them.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I guess we give about two hundred for Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: I give him nothing.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: That’s why he won’t fix anything for you.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: If he fixed something I'd give him money.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You know he has like twelve children.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: Nobody told him to do that.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: They're totally poor. They live in that one bedroom. His wife is ina wheelchair - I think.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I’ve never seen her ina wheelchair.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I’m pretty sure. I don’t see her often, though. Kate gets up and goes into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: So how do they make so many children.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: People can fuck in a wheelchair, Grandma. (to Alex) Can't they? Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (laughing) Why are you looking at me?

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: He’s a crook and a slime.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (to Alex) IE: he’s Puerto Rican. Just then Kate comes out of the kitchen with a birthday c She sings alone, briefly.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Happy birthday to you... Andra blows out the two candles as the cake is placed in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (meaning it) You're too nice. Kate cuts the cake and distributes it. Alex reaches aroun the chair and presents Andra with the basket full of bath beauty products.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: This is for you.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Wow. Those are some nice products!

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: People don’t spoil themselves enough, right? Andra removes one of the bottles, unable to figure out exactly what it does. She puts it down.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: I use Olay/Ponds. ALT:I can’t use this. Mary grabs the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I'll take it!

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: You will not. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Why.  Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (to Kate) She loves it. She just doesn’t know how to use them yet. Pause in the room.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (beat) So, what are you guys gonna do to Grandma’s apartment? You’re gonna break through and make this place bigger? What, like the living room? 5/19/08 40. Everyone freezes, not sure this is kosher to talk about.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: We've been wanting to redo the whole place anyway. You know, the kitchen. We could use another bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: You're going to have to change the tiles in there. They’re covered in mold. I’d re-tile the whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I’m sure they’re gonna gut it, grandma. And you’1ll be dead, you won't have to worry about it. Rebecca looks down, painfully uncomfortable that everyone talking about this.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Yeah, we'll probably gut everything.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Like a fish.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: What else, another bedroom?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Mary.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: What? Rebecca looks at Andra, then back at Mary. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Grandma, can they show us what they’re going to do?  38 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08 Andra ignores her, seemingly not interested, just eating cake.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Well, if you want to see. Kate gets up and walks to the other side of the room, explaining.

dialogues.speaker: KATE

dialogues.text: It’s gonna be gorgeous.

dialogues.text: Of course we can wait. There’s no hurry. We’re fine! Andra sits there, not really listening, and not yet a gho (Andra actually fades away).

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: You’re an alcoholic.

dialogues.speaker: KATE

dialogues.speaker: ALEX

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Andra. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Awful.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: It makes me feel bad for Rebecca.

dialogues.text: It makes me feel less guilty waiting for her to die.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (laughing) Shit!

dialogues.speaker: KATE

dialogues.text: Hey. You were flirting with the sister.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (to herself) Because she's pretty and young. 40 INT. ABBY’S BEDROOM - NIGHT 40 Abby sits at her desk pouring over a web site of expensiv jeans. She’s also inhaling an enormous piece of birthday cake. Kate enters and is about to say something but Abby glares her, trying to hide the cake.

FACE WORKS SPA/MARY’S TREATMENT ROOM - DAY 46 Alex lies on a treatment table while Mary examines his sk under a bright light and magnifier. He’s wearing little b eye cups.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I figure if Howard Stern can get facials, so can I.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Right?! You know he had his nose done.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Cheeks too. (beat) The guy’s never gonna hit the wall.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I know. I love Howard.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: He’s the best. Artie kills me.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I wish I could play him all day but I have to play this new age shit. It makes me want to kill myself.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I mean, what guy admits he’s got a small dick, right? How cool is that? Mary chuckles. Awkward pause. Alex instantly regrets sayi this. She pulls the steam machine over and turns it on. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08 As it blows on Alex's face, Mary caresses his cheeks, loo for blemishes.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: You've got nice skin.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I was covered in acne when I was a kid. My poor daughter has zits cuz of me. I guess it’s hereditary.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Don’t blame yourself! Anyway, you’d never know you had bad skin. You don’t have any scars. (beat) We'll let the steam open your pores. She stands up and comes around to massage one of his hand with cream.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (flinching) Oh -

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: It’s part of the European Facial. Shoulder massage, hand massage. Do you want it?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Sure. As Mary massages his fingers there’s a silence that ordinarily could seem normal, but here and now, is filled with tension. As Mary massages his hand, he starts to massage hers back She's confused. Maybe he doesn’t even know he’s doing it. Then, he gently pulls her closer to him. She’s not sure i this is on purpose or not. He pulls again. She looks at h but he’s wearing those little eye cups so she can’t read expression. This goes on for a while until he pulls her e closer, making his intentions unmistakable. Her body is now up against the table as Alex reaches for He sits up, losing his eye cups, and suddenly they’re kissing. After a moment, they break apart and Mary fumbles for the cups on the floor.  47 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (beat) I didn’t know you were going to do that.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I didn’t either. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Do you still want a facial?

dialogues.text: Those are good. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.text: She’s always there.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Tell me about it. My mom practically supports her.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.text: She always gives her money. How do you think a homeless person could have Chanel lipstick? It’s gross.

dialogues.text: Your mom gives her Chanel lipstick?

dialogues.text: Just money. She wants to save the world. One time, she let a homeless lady take a shower in our apartment.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Your mom? (surprised) Wow. That’s nice.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Oh my god!

dialogues.speaker: ABBY

dialogues.text: I don’t have one. I mean, she’s dead.

dialogues.text: Killed herself.

dialogues.text: I'm fifteen! What about your dad? He must’ve been so mad!

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: This is so disgusting. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08 Rebecca holds up her plastic bag filled with shit.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Right? And now we’re two people walking around with shit in a bag. Rebecca smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: I mean, what if we didn’t have dogs with us, and we were doing that. That would be sick. But because we have dogs, it’s normal.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I never thought of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate is sitting opposite a well-dressed woman, CARRIE-ANN

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE-ANNE
dialogues.text: So, what makes you feel like this would be a good time to volunteer? I mean, in your life.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Something is just telling me to do it, you know? To give something to someone.  58 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE-ANNE
dialogues.text: That's terrific. A lot of the guests here don't have family visit them. If they do, they come maybe once, twice a year. Generally they really appreciate the company.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I'm good at keeping company.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE-ANNE
dialogues.text: They love conversation. Of course we keep it light. Always try and cheer them up.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh. Why?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE-ANNE
dialogues.text: Well, we just don’t want to bring them down. Sometimes all they can think about is dying, so they’1l inevitably talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (confused) Shouldn't we?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE-ANNE
dialogues.text: Better if you steer them away from the topic. It just makes them sad.
