dialogues.text: 58 The woman gives Kate a tour. The place is depressing and dark. OLD PEOPLE mill about, lost and confused. Kate's positive demeanor is starting to sag.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE-ANNE
dialogues.text: This is the common area. We watch movies here on Saturday nights. Residents play cards, or just hang out. You could play games with them.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Carrie-Anne approaches an old woman, MAUREEN, slowly walking along. bent in half,  59 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE-ANNE
dialogues.text: Maureen, this is Kate. Kate's going to be volunteering here. Maureen just keeps going, as if she didn't hear.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (concerned) She's very bent over.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE ANNE
dialogues.text: (cheerful) Yes, she has rheumatoid arthritis!

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: How awful for her.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE-ANNE
dialogues.text: Well, we try to stay upbeat and positive as much as we can!

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (too loud) Hi Maureen. Maureen turns around, not sure where the sound is coming from. She looks from left to right, the way a deaf dog wo if you whistled at him.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE-ANNE
dialogues.text: We're here, Maureen. But Maureen is so confused, she just gives up and keeps hobbling along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca, dressed nicely, and Andra, wearing make-up and bundled up in coats are on the front steps.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: I don't need to meet anyone new at my age.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: You don't have to be friends with her.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: And I'm sure she feels the same way. Why do two old ladies want to become friends at this age?  60 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: We're just taking a drive, Grandma. The leaves are going to be really pretty.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: Pretty leaves are dead leaves.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (beat) They're here! She helps Andra out of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eugene is driving, Rebecca is beside him. Mrs. Portman an Andra sit in the backseat.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. PORTMAN
dialogues.text: It's cancer. A big lump.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: What a horror! Andra kindly puts a hand on Mrs. Portman’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. PORTMAN
dialogues.text: The breast comes off. Just like that. At least it's not in the other one.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Wouldn't you rather have a lumpectomy?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. PORTMAN
dialogues.text: What do I need my breast for? Safer to take it off.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: You might get a boyfriend and then what.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. PORTMAN
dialogues.text: You're funny, Andra!

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: See? She thinks I’m funny. She smiles at Mrs. Portman. It’s almost as if she’s flirt with her, willing her to be her friend.  Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry, Mrs. Portman.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. PORTMAN
dialogues.text: Call me Paulette. And it's okay. I'm an old lady. It’s a tragedy when it’s someone young. She pats the back of Eugene's head.

dialogues.speaker: PAULETTE
dialogues.text: I've been lucky.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: Cancer is not lucky.

dialogues.speaker: PAULETTE
dialogues.text: Okay, before the cancer.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: You got a handsome boy there.

dialogues.speaker: PAULETTE
dialogues.text: I know it!

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: Thank you, Andra.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: It’s the truth. She leans forward and "whispers" in Rebecca's ear. everyone can hear her.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: But he's very short. Rebecca is mortified.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Grandma -

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: (still "whispering" ) It's good. He would never go for you if he was tall. 63. But Eugene is so stunned, he starts to laugh. So does Rebecca Paulette can't quite believe it. Innocently, Andra turns Paulette and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: PAULETTE
dialogues.text: Rebecca is a lovely girl. I’m sure lots of boys notice her. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: What? I didn't say anything. (beat) I don’t like my food. It’s bad.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Mine’s good.

dialogues.speaker: PAULETTE
dialogues.text: You want some of mine?

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: Yours looks bad, too.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: Mine wasn’t so good.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: Right!?

dialogues.speaker: PAULETTE
dialogues.text: You have a lot of friends left, Andra?

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: Nobody's left. I had friends. Never a lot, though. (beat) I was very selective.

dialogues.speaker: PAULETTE
dialogues.text: Good for you. It’s good to be selective.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: A lot of people were jealous of me.

dialogues.speaker: PAULETTE
dialogues.text: Oh?

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: Because I was smart. People often mistook me for a school teacher. I didn’t finish high school but people thought I was smart. Eugene and Rebecca share a look, not knowing what the hel she’s talking about.

dialogues.speaker: PAULETTE
dialogues.text: (kindly) Well, I can see what you mean, I saw it right away.  Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: Your friends are all gone, right grandma? Paulette shrugs, resigned.

dialogues.speaker: PAULETTE
dialogues.text: All gone. That’s the deal. ALT: There’s a couple left. But not the good ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eugene’s car drives slowly along a pretty shaded road. 64A. 61 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08 62 INT. RENTAL CAR —- CONTINUOUS 62 Eugene and Rebecca sip coffee in the front seat. Andra is asleep, Paulette looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (looking at New York Magazine) I think it's supposed to be right around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca, Eugene and Paulette stand at the edge of the roa looking at a small mountain. Andra is still asleep in the car.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: It's not very colorful. The mountain is mostly bare, dark green or grey. No glori colored leaves.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: This can't be it.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Maybe we're too late. Or maybe it’s been too hot. Andra gets out of the car, groggy. She walks to them slow

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: PAULETTE
dialogues.text: We're looking at the view.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: This is nothing. They stand there for a bit. Then Eugene steps a couple of feet forward and turns to the right. He gasps - a differe mountain is exploding with oranges, reds and yellows. It' magnificent. Rebecca and Paulette follow him and take in beauty.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Oh my god.  64 65 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: PAULETTE
dialogues.text: Oh, that's gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: This must be their peak. As they admire the colors, Andra is still unaware that th have found the right spot, and keeps looking at the grey, dull view.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Grandma. But Andra doesn't hear her.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Grandma. Still no response. As Paulette and Eugene share a moment enjoying the view, Rebecca looks at the back of Andra's h Her thinning dyed hair has been flattened out every which by her nap in the car, creating a clear view of the large bald spot on the back of her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary is lying under Alex on the facial table. As they hav sex, she stares at the angels that decorate the aromather machine.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 65
dialogues.text: 66 67 68 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex is heading for the subway when he stops, in a daze. looks around him, thinking about what he’s done. He catch his reflection in a store window and fixes his crazy hair gazes at his belly. Then he sees through his belly into t actual store, and focuses on a woman’s shirt hanging in t window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poppy is a hip, over-priced clothing store. Alex is purchasing the shirt from an ATTRACTIVE SALES GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It’s for my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: ATTRACTIVE SALES GIRL
dialogues.text: How old is she?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Fifteen. She’s having a hard time.

dialogues.speaker: ATTRACTIVE SALES GIRL
dialogues.text: That’s so sweet of you to buy this! She's going to love it. She turns around and Alex looks at her sexy, toned back, in a tiny top. INT. KATE AND ALEX’S BEDROOM - NIGHT 68 Kate is on the bed while Abby opens up the bag from Poppy

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: God, this is so cute!

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You like it?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: I love it! Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Where did you get it?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Some store. She finds the bag.  69 70 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (knowing the store) What were you doing down there?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: (to Kate) Isn‘t it cute? Distracted, Kate looks at Abby.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (beat) It is. It’s very cute.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Thanks, Dad. He looks tenderly at Abby and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary is browsing around. The Attractive Sales Girl is pic at her cuticles. Mary observes her - what she’s wearing, and how her large shoulders are exposed in her tiny top.

dialogues.speaker: BIG BACK
dialogues.text: Hi. Can I help you find something?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (startled) Oh, no. Just looking, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: BIG BACK
dialogues.text: Be sure to let me know if you have any questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby is no longer in the room. Alex is watching Access Hollywood and Kate is putting lotion on her elbows.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter how much lotion I put on. They’re cracked and freaky. It's disgusting. Why? Why is it like this?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What?  71 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: My elbow. Look at it. If you take it away from what it’s attached to - She frames her elbow with her fingers.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: - what is it?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Your elbows look like that so you can use them. Like your feet.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh. (beat) Maybe I should go see whats-her- name. At the spa. Get some paraffin or something.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: She does facials.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Who are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: The granddaughter. With the tan. Who are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Same.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: She does facials?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It’s what she said. Kate shrugs. The ensuing silence makes the topic on Acces Hollywood the only conversation in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca, glowing with excitement, is throwing a nightgown over her head. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: They were so gorgeous, Mary! Like they were on fire! Mary, lying on the couch, is flipping through a magazine.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: You should have worn sunscreen.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I don't think I got sunburned.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: You did too. That could create sun damage.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: You're not at work. God.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: It's not just my work. I believe in what I do.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: You sunbathe!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: With sunscreen. (shamed) I look better with color.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: You're pretty. You don’t need to be tan.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I can’t stop. Rebecca climbs into her bed.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (bright) Maybe Eugene has a brother. Or a friend.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: What? Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I don’t need you to find me a boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: If I wanted a boyfriend, I'd have one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca is giving YOUNG WOMAN a mammogram.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: They were incredible, really beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
dialogues.text: I don't have a car.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Oh, you can rent one. Or even take the train. Rebecca fits the enormous breast on the plate of glass.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Just a little bit more...

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
dialogues.text: Oh, there's always more.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: But you have to hurry because they're just about to end. New York Magazine -

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
dialogues.text: I hate New York Magazine. The woman winces as Rebecca closes the glass on the breas

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
dialogues.text: That really hurts.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (apologetic) Unfortunately, the more it hurts, the better picture we get. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: But seriously, it’s really worth it if you get the chance to go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cathy and Marissa are filing when Rebecca enters the area They glance at her.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: (smug) Their peak was last week.

dialogues.speaker: MARISSA
dialogues.text: Yeah. It was definitely last week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex is fast asleep on Mary's facial table. She is shakin him.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Alex. You have to wake up. Alex. The spa is closing. He slowly opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I’m so tired.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Yeah, well you have to go. He climbs off, disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: How long was I asleep for?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: A long time.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I hate falling asleep in the middle of the day. I wake up feeling so lonely. She looks at him.  75 76 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate is walking, depressed. She passes a store that looks lot like her’s, and stops to look through the window. KATE’S POINT OF VIEW A HIP YOUNG COUPLE gesticulate excitedly about a fabulous lamp. She stares at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate wanders around the store. She glances at some price tags, feels a couple of chairs. She sees a table that loo just like the one she sold recently to the Young Man. She goes to it, curious, and reads the price - $5,000. Surpri she glances up and instantly sees the man she sold the ta to (for $3,000). This is his store, and that was her tabl At first she’s pissed, feels cheated, and is about to confront him. But The Man is helping another customer wit lot of concentration and Kate loses her steam. She decide instead to simply sit down on a nice couch and rest. A 60 year old woman, dressed overly-chic, (she’s ANITA), already sitting there.

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: Designer?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Resting.

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: I’m a designer. I buy a lot from Kevin. He’s got great taste, doesn’t he? Except for that awful thing. Anita points to a leather chair that’s weird looking.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: That’s a rare piece.

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: It’s still ugly. I think it’s haunted. It has a bad vibe. (beat) Old furniture has to have some ghosts. Don’t you think? Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I do think that, yes.

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: How can it not? Right? I had this bed, it was iron, Victorian. Gorgeous. Fabulous detail. I had nightmares for a year. And I developed TMJ. Got rid of the bed, no more TMJ, no more nightmares. Kate smiles at her, and then watches Kevin.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (re: Kevin) Nice guy?

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: Prick. Good taste. Still a prick. 77 omitted 77  78 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Kate are turning the lights on all of the lamps around the store. TWO ANNOYED SHOPPERS wander around touc furniture.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOYED SHOPPER
dialogues.text: (quietly) My grandmother had this exact couch.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER ANNOYED SHOPPER
dialogues.text: Where is it now?

dialogues.speaker: ANNOYED SHOPPER
dialogues.text: Here, apparently. Nobody knew to save it. I’m sure my mother thought it was junk. (sing song) Someone's making a killing. They glance at Kate and Alex.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (unaware) Isn't that beautiful? Original upholstery.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOYED SHOPPER
dialogues.text: What a find.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER ANNOYED SHOPPER
dialogues.text: Where do you find this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (beat) Why?

dialogues.speaker: OTHER ANNOYED SHOPPER
dialogues.text: Do you buy from individuals or like, a store in Queens? I’m just curious. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Individuals.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (defensive) We buy from the children of dead people.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOYED SHOPPER
dialogues.text: (beat) How nice.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yes. Kate smiles, grateful. The Annoyed Shopper walks off.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOYED SHOPPER
dialogues.text: (to his friend) Look at this table. This would look great in at your place in New Paltz.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER ANNOYED SHOPPER
dialogues.text: It would. It’s beautiful. The phone rings and Kate answers it.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Modern Age...yes, we do. Oh, I’m sorry to hear that...

dialogues.speaker: ANNOYED SHOPPER
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Ambulance chaser. 79 INT. DEAD MOM’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 79 Kate is being shown around the apartment by a distraught, DON, 40.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Mom loved her things. But she never said what we should do with them. A cold woman, ELYSE, also 40, comes into the room.

dialogues.speaker: ELYSE
dialogues.text: Are you from the Salvation Army?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: She’s from a store on tenth avenue. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: ELYSE
dialogues.text: A junk store?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: More of a vintage, or mid century modern -

dialogues.speaker: ELYSE
dialogues.text: She doesn’t want this shit, Don. I told you to call the Salvation Army. Kate looks around the cluttered place. True, everything i junky, worthless.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: She can say if she doesn’t want anything. But maybe she will.

dialogues.speaker: ELYSE
dialogues.text: (to Kate) Would you please wake this man up? None of this is worth anything. Right? He wasted your time.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: (to Kate) Look at this chair. This was her favorite. (beat, quietly) She died in it. Kate looks at the old, yellow chair.

dialogues.speaker: ELYSE
dialogues.text: Now she’s really going to want to buy it!

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Actually, I think I could take this dining table and chairs. And probably the side tables. Don looks at Elyse, happy.

dialogues.speaker: ELYSE
dialogues.text: For how much.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Two thousand.

dialogues.speaker: ELYSE
dialogues.text: Are you serious? Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: And the yellow chair.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: (vindicated) Mom had good taste. 80 INT. ANDRA’S APARTMENT — DAY 80 Mary is staring down at Andra, who is cutting coupons at dining table. Andra holds out a fat stack for her.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: Use these.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I will not.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: What are you talking about, ‘I will not’?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I won't.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: You'll take my coupons.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: No, I won't.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: You’re too good for coupons?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: They depress me. (beat) If you want me to go shopping for you, give me your list.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: Why can’t Rebecca go?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I told you. She’s busy.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: She’s never busy.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: That’s been lucky for you, hasn’t it? Give me your list. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: If you’re not going to use my coupons then I’1l go shopping myself.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I came all the way over here. And you can’t walk that far.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: You'll see. When my knees are better, I won’t need anybody.  81 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Arthritis gets worse, not better.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: Mine’s going to get better.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Like your eyes?

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: And your feet? Andra gets up from the table and pushes the coupons away angrily.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: Don’t do me any favors. I’1l wait until Rebecca can do it. She doesn’t ask me all these questions. She sits in front of the TV set and turns it up VERY LOUD

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Your feet hurt ‘cause you’re old, Grandma. Things don’t get better. They get worse. EXT. ANDRA’S APARTMENT/HALLWAY - DAY 81 Mary comes out of the apartment with Andra’s grocery list slamming the door behind her. She looks at Alex’s apartme door when it suddenly opens. Mary quickly races to the elevator. Kate and Alex come out, chatting. Kate locks the door beh them. They walk to the elevator, seeing Mary. Alex instan blushes.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Oh, hi.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Hi, how’re you doing?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Pretty good. She’s got me going to the market for her.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Still got that tan! Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08 Kate glances at him.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: It's kind of fading actually. (beat) I think I’m hitting the wall. Kate glances at her, surprised she knows this expression. They all get into the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Well, that’s nice of you, to shop for her.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Not much of a choice. I guess I could starve her to death! Alex looks at Mary’s breasts.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Where do you go shopping?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: In a market.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all come out of the building. Mary walks off.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: See you around. Alex looks at Kate.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You know, I’ve got some errands.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (suspicious) Oh.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Just crap I've been putting off. I’1l meet you at the store? Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Okay. See you later. Alex gives her a quick kiss and ponders which way to go. walks a few steps and then stops, feeling something is of After a moment, she continues on her way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex catches up to Mary before she goes into the market.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (surprised) Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eugene and Rebecca sip coffees and walk down the street.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you do.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: I’m a computer consultant.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Oh! That's nice.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: Nobody knows what that is.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I guess not.  86 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: That’s okay. Keeps me mysterious.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I want to know.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: Now you. You have a great job. I mean, from a guy’s point of view. I wonder what made you pick it.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (curious too) Yeah...I wonder that, too.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: Were you breast fed?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I doubt it. No. No.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: Well, there you are!

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I don’t even see them like breasts, though. I see them like they’re these tubes of potential danger.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: Tubes of potential danger. I see a Penthouse Letter somewhere in there.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: You never read those? My dad had them - you know, Penthouse magazine - lying around the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DELIVERY MEN unload the junky, worthless furniture from t old apartment into the store. It looks crazy next to the stylish stuff.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Put that in the window, please. He puts the shabby couch in the window. A STYLISH COUPLE enter the store. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Welcome. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: STYLISH WOMAN SHOPPER
dialogues.text: Thank you. I see you’ve got some new things!

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: All the time! They browse, looking at pieces, sitting on them, etc.

dialogues.speaker: STYLISH MAN SHOPPER
dialogues.text: Where do you find all this?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (defensive) Why?

dialogues.speaker: STYLISH MAN SHOPPER
dialogues.text: (taken aback) Just curious.

dialogues.speaker: STYLISH WOMAN SHOPPER
dialogues.text: I love this lounge chair, honey. Come sit.

dialogues.speaker: STYLISH MAN SHOPPER
dialogues.text: It’s great. Perfect for the kid’s room. (to Kate) How much do you want for this?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: That’s four thousand.

dialogues.speaker: STYLISH WOMAN SHOPPER
dialogues.text: (undeterred) It is perfect for the kids room. They smile at one another excitedly. Then the stylish man sees an old table from the junky shipment.

dialogues.speaker: STYLISH MAN SHOPPER
dialogues.text: Honey. Take a look at this.

dialogues.speaker: STYLISH WOMAN SHOPPER
dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.speaker: STYLISH MAN SHOPPER
dialogues.text: It’s so bad, it’s almost great.

dialogues.speaker: STYLISH WOMAN SHOPPER
dialogues.text: I know what you mean. Kate stays out of it. They ponder it.  87 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: STYLISH MAN SHOPPER
dialogues.text: It’s pretty cool. It would fit in that weird corner, you know? (to Kate) Excuse me, how much is this table?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. (thinking quickly) That’s twelve hundred.

dialogues.speaker: STYLISH WOMAN SHOPPER
dialogues.text: (surprised) Is it important?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: We're not certain of its designer. No. The couple walks around the ugly table, falling in love w it. Kate slumps, depressed. She stares at the yellow chai that the woman died in, and can’t seem to look away. When she does look away, WE SEE THE GHOST OF THE DEAD WOM sitting in the chair. After a moment, she fades away. INT. ANDRA’S APARTMENT — DAY 87 Andra is sitting in front of the LOUD SCRAMBLED TV. She’s screaming into the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA
dialogues.text: Come up here and fix the reception! What?...yes, it’s your job! You’re the super! The super fixes things! I can’t see a thing! (hanging up) Idiot. She wanders into the kitchen BUT WE STAY IN THE LIVING RO WE ONLY HEAR HER.

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Leaving me here with nothing to eat. WE HEAR some drawers opening and closing. Then the refrigerator. She takes something out of it, and we hear can opener puncturing a can. Then a LOUD POP and a splash

dialogues.speaker: ANDRA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, shit. What a mess. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08 88 INT. REBECCA AND MARY’S BEDROOM - DAY 88 Mary and Alex have just had sex on Mary’s bed. They lie there, half dressed. Mary’s face is tense.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: It’s not like I think you’re my boyfriend, or anything. I was just wondering if we could have you know, like a real date or something.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (beat) You know I’ve never cheated on Kate.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: How would I know that?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Well, I haven't.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: So, why now?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: We're like partners. Partners at work, partners as parents. We’re friends. We’re good friends.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I like my friends. (kind of joking) I don’t really have any --

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (confused) Yeah. Friends are good. They are.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: So, maybe we could go see the fucking leaves.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Oh, gosh. I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: It’s probably over.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (beat) I'm sorry.  Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Do you feel guilty?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Then take me out. He smirks. She misunderstood. 85A. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It's a mess. I’m a mess. I never want her to find out. (beat) I know it sounds crazy but maybe this will even help things.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Maybe you and I will help your marriage?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: They say that happens.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: How could you be that callous. To me.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (realizing) Oh, you’re so right. I didn’t really mean it that way. Depressed, Mary flips on the TV from the bed, watches something.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (resigned) I don’t want to fuck you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby and Kate walk the dog.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Have you ever thought about killing yourself?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (startled) No! Why would you ask me that?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Rebecca’s mother killed herself.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: That’s horrible. (beat) No wonder. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: No wonder what?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You can see how damaged those girls are. (alarmed) You don’t ever think about things like that, do you? Abby rolls her eyes. Kate drops it.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (looking around) I wonder where our friend is.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Make up man?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Yeah. They look around.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Hopefully he found a nice spot near Sephora.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I hope nothing happened to her.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: You're worried.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: A little. She lives on the street.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: You don’t even know her.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh god, look at this. They approach an OLD MAN surrounded by bags and trash. He holding out his hand. Kate stops and opens her purse. Abb rolls her eyes as Kate takes out a ten and holds it out f him.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: (seeing the bill) No way. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08 Abby snatches the money.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Abby!

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: You don’t give me ten dollars!

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (seething) You give that man that money right now and we’ll discuss this later.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I buy you everything you need.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: I’m keeping this ten dollars! Kate is so embarrassed, so mortified, she’s (for once) speechless. She searches in her wallet and takes out a fi dollar bill.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Abby, I don’t have another ten.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: So give him the five.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (more appalled than ever) Give him the ten!

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: No! Defeated, Kate hands the five to the old man.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (to old man) I’m sorry. I’m so ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: Suck my dick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca and Eugene are lying on a blanket on his tar roof The evening is warm, the stars are out. Nervously, Eugene leans over Rebecca and kisses her. It’s gentle but charge  91 92 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08 Across the street, a FEW PEOPLE are having a barbecue on roof. Rebecca and Eugene look over and watch them. After a beat, Rebecca lies back, enjoying the smell of th barbecue, and where she is. INT. KATE AND ALEX’S BEDROOM - NIGHT 91 Kate is lying in bed in the dark, wide awake. Alex comes and thinking she’s asleep, undresses quietly. He slides i bed as smoothly as possible, his back to her. They lie th for a bit. Then -

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Our daughter is a sociopath. Alex takes this in, not quite sure how to respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex is looking at the crappy furniture arranged with the nice stuff, all over the store.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you were thinking!

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: The guy. His sister or wife or whoever was so mean, I had to buy it. I felt bad for him. (reaching) And who's to say that this stuff isn’t valuable?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I can. This stuff isn’t valuable.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Somebody designed it. Maybe in fifteen years this chair - (gestures to yellow chair) - will be worth a ton of money because some genius German designed it.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: We'll never sell any of it. Kate goes and sits in the yellow chair. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I already sold one piece for a lot of money.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You did?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I don’t exactly feel good about it.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: That’s great!

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No, it’s not.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I don’t understand.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I practically stole from them.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: So why did you charge them a lot of money?! She thinks about this, surprised by it.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (beat) I wanted to.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: And therein lies the mystery of being human.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: And I’ve been feeling very suspicious lately, Alex. He freezes. Waits. Suddenly his face softens with guilt.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: A couple of people have come in here, people who don’t look like they're shopping for our kind of furniture. And they’re asking questions.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (relieved) Like what?  93 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Like, “where did you get this?” And “How do you find your things?” You heard those two rude people.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: People ask that all the time. They're curious.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No. I think that some of the people we've bought from asked their friends, or their lawyers to come in and see how much we’re charging.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Your guilt is warping you.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (beat) Why isn’t it warping you?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It is. Your guilt is warping me. She smirks at him.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: If doing this makes you feel so bad let's stop doing it.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: But then someone else will just do what we're doing. The guy on eighth avenue - you know that store? He’s buying from us and selling it for more! Us quitting isn’t going to help. (beat) Nothing helps. INT. ANDRA’S APARTMENT — DAY 93 Rebecca enters Andra’s apartment.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Hi Grandma! She sees Andra in her chair in front of the TV but goes t the kitchen because she sees a mess.  94 95 96 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08 INT. ANDRA’S APARTMENT/KITCHEN - CONTINUOUS 94 She finds an opened, bulging can of grapefruit juice on t counter, and juice splattered everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Grandma? No response. INT. ANDRA’S LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS 95 Sitting in front of the TV as it plays ENTERTAINMENT TONI (the reception slightly better,) Andra slumps, unconsciou

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Oh my god, Grandma! Grandma? Wake up! She shakes her shoulder and realizes she’s dead. Stunned, looks up at the TV show and gets momentarily engrossed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large room filled with mats and weights, a mirror on on wall. PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES work out. A woman in a suit, MRS. MELNICK, gives Kate a tour.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. MELNICK
dialogues.text: This, obviously, is the gym where they can work out. The patients come in here once a day, for about an hour. This is something you could actually help out with! Kate looks at the faces of the struggling patients. Some more severely disabled than others, barely able to move t limbs with any control.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: It looks like it’s painful.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. MELNICK
dialogues.text: Oh, no. They look forward to this all day! Let me introduce you to someone. She walks her over to a severely disabled YOUNG GIRL with sweet face. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: MRS. MELNICK
dialogues.text: Sweetie, this is Kate. She’s going to be helping out. The girl smiles holds out a twisted hand.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. MELNICK
dialogues.text: Kate, this is Abby. Abby, this is Kate. Kate is startled by the girl’s name.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. MELNICK
dialogues.text: Abby here is one of our most athletic. Aren’t you Abby?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Yes I am.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. MELNICK
dialogues.text: Would you like to show Kate how well you can do a cartwheel?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh, no, she doesn’t have to.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. MELNICK
dialogues.text: I think you’d like to, wouldn’t you Abby?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No, really - it’s okay. Abby #2 goes to the mat and does a very clumsy, spastic cartwheel. When she’s done, she looks over at Kate, beami with pride. Kate starts to cry and hides her face.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (whispering to Mrs. Melnick) Oh my god, it’s just so sad.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. MELNICK
dialogues.text: (beat) Please stop.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I don’t mean to - I’m so sorry. I don’t know how you can take it - Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Bye lady!!

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Bye! That was really good! Kate turns, unable to hide her tears. A sob escapes.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. MELNICK
dialogues.text: You're going to have to leave.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I know, I know - I’m so sorry, so sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the stall, Kate is sitting on the toilet trying to stop crying. She mops up her tears with rough toilet pape She hears the door to the rest room open and she stiffens After a beat...ABBY #2 ENTERS.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Do you need help? Kate doesn’t answer, doesn’t know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Do you want someone to help you? 98 INT. ANDRA’S APARTMENT/LIVING ROOM - DAY 98 Mary is in the other room while Rebecca sits on the couch Andra is still in her chair.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (beat) I should've been here. I would have been here.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, please. If I’d bought her her fucking groceries I would have been here.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Why didn't you buy her groceries? I thought you were supposed to.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: How can she not have any papers? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08 MARY (0.S.) (cont'd) I thought you knew where she put everything.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Not her papers, I guess. She didn’t own anything. What are you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I don’t know. It’s what you do. Oh, now here’s something she got a lot of use from. Mary enters the living room and holds up the new nightgow they bought her. She shakes it at Andra.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: No special occasion, Grandma! You should have worn the fucker!!

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: God, Mary. You’re so mean.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Grandma was mean. (beat) Why do you think Mom took eighty five Valium? Because her mother was loving and kind?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: You can’t blame Grandma.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I don’t know. (beat) We don’t have any family anymore.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Oy. (beat) I have to go back to work.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I have appointments. You’1ll wait for the guy?  99 100 101 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (struck) We have no family left and you’re going to work.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay. You’re right. Mary sits beside Rebecca on the couch. Long pause. They s there.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Oh look! We still have no family left! Bye. She gets up.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: You’re so cold.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 99
dialogues.text: INT. KATE AND ALEX’S KITCHEN - DAY 100 Kate is washing dishes, crying. She hears a KNOCK on the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate opens the door and finds Rebecca. She tries to clear away any tears.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh, Hi.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (brushing it off) Oh, I’m fine! I guess washing dishes just makes me want to kill myself! (remembering) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 102 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08 KATE (cont'd) I mean - not really - it’s just an expression - I didn’t mean -

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I just wanted to tell you my grandma died. Kate pulls her inside.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh my god! Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Can you die if you eat something from a dented can?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You think that’s what happened?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: We're not sure. (beat) I've been taking care of my grandma for so many years. This pill that day, this doctor, this medicine, not that medicine. And she dies from drinking bad juice.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You’re a good person. Rebecca has to hold back tears, for this is exactly what needed to hear.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Thanks. So are you. INT. ANDRA’S APARTMENT - DAY A102 Andra, alone in the room and still in her chair, slowly f away.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 102
dialogues.text: 103 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH THE STORE FRONT WINDOW, WE SEE ABBY approach the and check the name of it. She nervously enters.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Welcome to Face Works. How can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: I’m a walk in.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: It says you welcome walk ins. I'ma walk in.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: We certainly do welcome walk ins. What can I do for you today?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: I want a facial with Mary, please. He checks his book.  104 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: She actually had a cancellation, if you can wait thirty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Sure. She sits down in the waiting area and turns on her ipod. music is VERY LOUD, and the song keeps repeating MOTHERFU over and over. The PEACEFUL WOMAN seated next to her is severely agitated and shoots Abby, whose oblivious, dirty looks. Abby picks at a zit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby is lying down on the table with steam blowing on her face. Mary is sitting behind her.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: It really worked out well, someone had just cancelled. (beat) This is quite a surprise.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Rebecca said she thought you could do something for my bad skin.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I’m sure I can. We’ll open up these pores and clean you out. Ever have a facial?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Well, my mom took me for one, once, at this really fancy place? She thinks it’s good for people to spoil themselves, or something. Anyway, it didn’t help. They just rubbed a bunch of cream on and made it worse.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: That’s too bad. Well, just know it’s not your fault. It’s hereditary.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Yeah, my dad supposedly had bad skin. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: That's right, he said it was terrible. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: (beat) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: But have you noticed it now?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: He doesn’t have acne anymore but I think we’ve really improved the quality of his skin.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you’re talking about.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (beat, blase) He’s come in for facials.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: (beat, tensing up) My dad?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Sure. Hey, Howard Stern gets them. A lot of men do. Abby smiles, uncomfortable. She doesn’t understand what M is telling her, but she knows it’s making her feel bad.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Anyway, that’s enough steam. Let’s get started. She puts the little black eye cups on Abby and then turns bright light over her face, illuminating every blemish. M starts to squeeze the zits.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Sorry, honey. It’s not fun. She squeezes hard. Abby braces herself.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Ow ow ow.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: So. Your parents will be glad to know my grandmother died. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: (wincing in pain) She did? Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Now your mother can have a bigger master bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: That’s too bad. I mean, I’m sorry she died. When did it happen?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Not sure. We found her today, so probably last night. (beat) Oh, here’s a deep one. She goes in for the deep pimple. Abby’s face clenches.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (beat) Wiggle your toes. Abby wiggles her toes.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (beat) I don’t know. It’s supposed to help.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: (recalling their conversation at the dinner party) That’s like one of those things - that we hate?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (not connecting) What?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: You know, like when people won't tell you the truth - like if you look bad in something?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I don’t follow.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Like saying wiggle your toes- it’s just like a ...whatever. (beat) So. When did my dad come in here? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08 ABBY (cont'd) I can’t picture it.  105 106 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (beat) He came in a few times.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Oh. With the knot in her stomach from what Mary is inferring the pain from the extractions, hot tears spill out of her little eye cups and run down her cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (unaware) We should give you an enzyme peel. That will definitely get all the dead skin off. It kind of makes you look like you got hit by a truck, but in the end it’s worth it. INT. ANDRA’S APARTMENT/BUILDING HALLWAY- LATER 105 An AMBULANCE GUY talks to Rebecca.

dialogues.speaker: AMBULANCE GUY
dialogues.text: Does the building have a back door? You know, for delivery’s, things like that? (explaining) So we don’t have to go out the front. You know. Not a glamorous sight.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: In the basement there’s a door to the alley but there’s always a ton of stuff blocking it. I think there’s an exit through the super’s apartment. INT. SUPERINTENDANT’S APARTMENT - DAY 106 The ambulance guys carry the stretcher through the tiny, cluttered apartment. CHILDREN are scattered about. Kate a Rebecca follow behind. The SUPER, DARIO, looks on without feeling, while his wif ELENA is distraught.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, it’s so messy. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh, no, we're disturbing you! Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry about your grandmother.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: DARIO
dialogues.text: She makes me fix her TV! She doesn’t even give me any money! I see her last night! She not dead then! She yelling at me like I’m some kind of kid!

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry she did that. Rebecca reaches into her back pocket for some money.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Let me -

dialogues.speaker: DARIO
dialogues.text: I don’t need a tip. She’s dead.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (to Elena) I’m very happy to see you’ve gotten better.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: I was not sick.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Weren’t you - weren’t you in a wheelchair?

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: (startled) Me?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Oh, I must’ve thought of someone -

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Who told you I was in wheelchair? I was never in a wheelchair! (spooked) Why did you say this?  107 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08 Just then Kate turns and sees the gift basket she bought Andra sitting on the coffee table - filled with all of th products. The basket is a little bent but everything is arranged with care. INT.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Where did you get that?

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: This.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: (defensive) It was a gift. KATE AND ALEX’S APARTMENT - DAY 107 Kate comes into the apartment to find Abby removing her c

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: The old lady died.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Your face! What happened?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: I had a facial.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: From who?!

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Mary.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What did she do to you?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: She gave me a peel. Plus she worked on me forever.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: It shouldn’t look like this. I’m going to call her right now. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: (over reacting)

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: Kate looks at Abby - wondering why she feels so strongly.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: (beat) It’s not her fault I have bad skin. This is normal. She said it would go away. Kate goes to her and strokes her hair.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: It will, honey. It will go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary comes out of the spa bundled up against cold. She lo at the store Poppy across the street.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 109
dialogues.text: 110 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary slowly walks in front of the store, checking it out, watching Big Back. She crosses a couple of times and is startled when Big Back comes out of the store.

dialogues.speaker: BIG BACK
dialogues.text: Who are you!? Startled as hell, Mary jumps back.

dialogues.speaker: BIG BACK
dialogues.text: I’ve seen you walk by, over and over. For months! And then you come in and pretend to shop! Who are you? Why are you watching me?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I’m Brian’s old girlfriend, Mary.

dialogues.speaker: BIG BACK
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: And I guess I wanted to see what he threw me over for.

dialogues.speaker: BIG BACK
dialogues.text: (creeped) That’s why you watch me.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: To see what you had that I didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: BIG BACK
dialogues.text: And did you figure out what that was?  111 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: No. You have nothing. (beat) You have a very large back. Big Back turns to go back into the store, but she hesitat

dialogues.speaker: BIG BACK
dialogues.text: I like my back. (beat) What kind of person - at your age - does something like this? It’s pathetic. I don’t even go out Brian anymore. Mary stands there, humiliated as Big Back goes inside. INT. ABBY’S BEDROOM - NIGHT 111 Alex comes in to the room, finding Abby asleep on her bed sits down beside her and notices the damage on her face. picks up the melting ice pack on her pillow, and Abby ope her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What happened, sweetie?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Rough pimple night?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: (beat) Mary gave me a facial. It hurt. Alex takes this in, struggles with how to react.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Mary.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You mean, the granddaughter from next door? Guess she’s not very good, no offense!

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: I’m not going back there. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: God, no. Of course not. Abby rolls over, her back to Alex.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: And neither should you. Alex stiffens. A nightmare come true.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Me.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: She said you went there.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, I did. She helped my skin. At my age, can you imagine. When does it stop? (beat) Yeah. No. Nobody should go back to her. Ever.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 112 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08 INT. KATE AND ALEX’S BEDROOM - NIGHT A112 Alex, anxious as hell, sees Kate reading in bed. He lies next to her.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: How’s she doing?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: She's sad.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: It’s so rough, her age. Alex puts his arms around her and she continues to read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the store front, WE SEE Alex approach the spa and enter. He finds Tommy and Mary chatting.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (startled) Oh, Hi. Do you have an appointment?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Can I speak to you? They take a few steps away from Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What did you tell my daughter? Mary looks at Tommy, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What did you tell her?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Jesus. I guess I just mentioned that you came here. He stares at her for more.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: That’s all.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Why did you do that? That’s so fucked up! Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I don’t know, we were talking.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Why did you tell her I come here?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Because you do.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Did you do that to her face on purpose?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: No. I do that to everyone’s face. It goes away in a couple of days. It’s normal.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (beat) What else did you tell her? She looks at him, studying him. Just then a SPA CLIENT (ALISON) enters and greets Mary with a wave.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (to Alex) I’m going back to work. I’m ready for you, Alison. Mary reaches out for Alison and leads her out of the reception area and through the side door. Alex stands the feeling Tommy’s stare. But when he looks up, he finds Tom smiling kindly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca and Mary are taking frozen dinners out of their boxes. They put them in the microwave.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: You know we should stand back.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Microwaves, they’re bad for you. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: But we're cooking our food in it.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Not the same. They say it’s different, what comes out. They stand there anyway, watching their dinners turn arou and around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary and Rebecca eat their dinners on the couch. When Mar finishes hers she puts the plate on the coffee table and just sits there. After a moment, she leans against the back of the couch a rests her head on Rebecca’s shoulder. Rebecca is startled but moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate is standing outside a large house, holding the vase the gold leaves. She knocks on the door and a man, Adam, one she bought this vase from in the beginning) answers t door.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Yes, Hi - I’m the woman who bought all of your mother’s furniture a while back. We own Modern Age.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (holding out the vase) I thought you should have this. It turned out to be worth a lot of money. He takes the vase and looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Seriously? I thought it was all junk. (beat, impressed) Thanks. Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You’re welcome.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: How much is it worth?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: About a thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you brought it back. That’s pretty unusual, especially in New York. Thanks again.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: It’s my pleasure. See you. He shuts the door. Kate smiles, pleased with herself. OFF SCREEN we hear a loud crash.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, shit!

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 116
dialogues.text: Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andra’s small funeral. Rebecca, Mary, a couple of OLDER PEOPLE from the building, and Kate, Abby, and Alex. Eugene and his grandmother Paulette sit behind them. A FUNERAL DIRECTOR speaks to them while standing at a pul On it, is the urn with Andra’'s ashes inside it.

dialogues.speaker: FUNERAL DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: (reading) Andra participated in many groups over the years and especially enjoyed volunteering. She worked at the ASPCA when she was a teenager, and later on read to the blind, and did art projects with underprivileged children. Mary looks at Rebecca and mouths “she did?” Rebecca mouth back, “I think so.” Just then Mary catches Alex’s glance, but he looks away. is aware of them, and stiffens. Kate sees all of the exchanges. Alex takes Abby’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: FUNERAL DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: She enjoyed reading a great deal, but when her eyes began to fail her she especially loved watching television. Her favorite show was Entertainment Tonight.  118 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08 Alex looks down, embarrassed. Kate pokes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The service is over and the guests are standing around. M chats with the Funeral Director. Rebecca introduces Eugen and Paulette to Kate, Alex and Abby.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: Very nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: PAULETTE
dialogues.text: Andra was a lovely woman.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Not really. But thanks.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: She had a sad life.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: (sounding just like Kate) You just say that so you can think that your life is more important than hers was.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: That’s true.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: So, you're going to start renovating.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Pretty soon.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I’m sure it’s going to be great.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Well, it’s definitely going to be bigger.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: I’m gonna take her dog. I guess we won't be seeing you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Yeah. We’ve sort of been neighbors.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: You guys can visit each other.  119 120 Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Absolutely. You’1ll have to come visit. Right?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Totally.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Definitely. They stand there awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the funeral, Kate, Alex and Abby walk down the stre together.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Her boyfriend was so handsome.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: He was. Very. He seemed nice.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: But so short.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Maybe he doesn’t mind.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh, he minds.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You can’t know that.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Yes, she can. They walk some more and pass a clothing store. Abby slows looking in the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Alex are standing by the dressing room, waiting Abby to come out. When she does, she’s wearing a pair of tight jeans that don’t really flatter her figure. However, by the way she is walking over to the mirror, it clear she feels hot.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: What do you think? Untitled Nicole Holofcener Project 2008 - Yellow 5/19/08

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I think they look good. Abby checks the price tag and looks shocked, guilty and thrilled all at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: I think they cost two hundred and thirty five dollars! (beat) They’re so cute.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You can get them.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Really!?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You want them?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: (out of her mind) Oh my god! Alex and Kate watch as Abby turns to look though it feels almost too intimate to do Abby studies herself, and doesn’t seem to scabs or the bulge of her tummy. She sees emerging, in expensive jeans, and at this what she sees. in the mirror, even so. see the zits or the her true self very moment, likes
